intro: Tuberaria vulgaris f. alpestris, commonly known as the Alpine Tuberaria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Cariophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Tuberaria vulgaris f. alpestris is often found in meadows and open slopes above the tree line.
